item.title: BBC Research & Development
item.description: Hello to our new followers, which, for the one and only time, is everyone...We'll be verifying our account very soon, but in the meantime, our top level domain should hopefully help confirm our identity, and we've also written about why we're here on Mastodon, what was involved to get here, and the other BBC accounts you can follow.Say hi, follow and give us a boost!https://www.bbc.co.uk/rd/blog/2023-07-mastodon-distributed-decentralised-fediverse-activitypub

item.title: Lili Karashchuk
item.description: Alright I defended my thesis! I'll be working at the Allen Institute for Neural Dynamics next. I will improve Anipose to make it even easier to set up 3D tracking for animals. I will also collect a large dataset of muscle dynamics & 3D kinematics on mice for building musculoskeletal models.I'm excited to hang out in this space again. Will experiment with posting progress and thoughts on new papers here more often.#neuroscience

item.title: Dr. jonny phd
item.description: Dear #neuromatchstodon - I want to call a vote on enabling elasticsearch/full text #search on the instance! I have gone through and tried to summarize how the search works, including what is indexed and what can be searched by who here: https://wiki.neuromatch.io/SearchAs far as I know no such official documentation exists, so hopefully that's helpful for other instances as well, please fact check me!The search filters are actually much more limited than I thought - full text search does not index every post that reaches the index, and it only allows a subset of accounts (mostly those that have interacted with the status in some way) to search a given post. I'd like to discuss any modifications we might like to make to the default behavior, unless other members feel like we shouldn't have it at all. Specifically I'd like to exclude posts from accounts with a 'noindex' tag in bio, among others. There are also additional search implementations that build on the base masto search we can consider. That wiki page will index conversations that happen in different places, so feel free to reply here, edit that wiki page, or join the thread we're having in the techwg-hacks channel in the discord (invite link in your announcements)

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: The mystery of the Vickers citation solved. Hint, it involves papermills and citation farming.h/t to Maarten van Kampen and Alexander Magazinov https://forbetterscience.com/2023/07/31/the-vickers-curse-secret-revealed/

item.title: hxresistance
item.description: "Remember quarantine when everyone was making bread and dancing and making art...."No, I don't remember that quarantine. My quarantine looked remarkably like my workaday life, except it also came with existential dread everytime I had to go outside. My workload did not decrease, nor did the nature of my work change significantly - just the location where I did it. And the fact that I only got to see friends, family, and colleagues, when I saw them at all, in tiny little boxes on the screen.It sucked.

item.title: Bartul Mimica
item.description: Unique (funded) postdoc opportunity with our lab at Princeton at the intersection of optical imaging and sex hormones. Experience measuring and manipulating hormones a plus. Work with cool bicoastal team including Stephanie Correa, Ed van Veen labs at UCLA and Eartha Mae Guthman here at Princeton Neuroscience Institute. Send inquiries to Annegret here: https://www.falknerlab.com/contact
